verses.name: Psalms 105:1
verses.text: O give thanks unto the Lord; call upon his name: make known his deeds among the people.

verses.name: Psalms 105:2
verses.text: Sing unto him, sing psalms unto him: talk ye of all his wondrous works.

verses.name: Psalms 105:3
verses.text: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the Lord.

verses.name: Psalms 105:4
verses.text: Seek the Lord, and his strength: seek his face evermore.

verses.name: Psalms 105:5
verses.text: Remember his marvellous works that he hath done; his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

verses.name: Psalms 105:6
verses.text: O ye seed of Abraham his servant, ye children of Jacob his chosen.

verses.name: Psalms 105:7
verses.text: He is the Lord our God: his judgments are in all the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 105:8
verses.text: He hath remembered his covenant for ever, the word which he commanded to a thousand generations.

verses.name: Psalms 105:9
verses.text: Which covenant he made with Abraham, and his oath unto Isaac;

verses.name: Psalms 105:10
verses.text: And confirmed the same unto Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant:

verses.name: Psalms 105:11
verses.text: Saying, Unto thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance:

verses.name: Psalms 105:12
verses.text: When they were but a few men in number; yea, very few, and strangers in it.

verses.name: Psalms 105:13
verses.text: When they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another people;

verses.name: Psalms 105:14
verses.text: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes;

verses.name: Psalms 105:15
verses.text: Saying, Touch not mine anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

verses.name: Psalms 105:16
verses.text: Moreover he called for a famine upon the land: he brake the whole staff of bread.

verses.name: Psalms 105:17
verses.text: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was sold for a servant:

verses.name: Psalms 105:18
verses.text: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron:

verses.name: Psalms 105:19
verses.text: Until the time that his word came: the word of the Lord tried him.

verses.name: Psalms 105:20
verses.text: The king sent and loosed him; even the ruler of the people, and let him go free.

verses.name: Psalms 105:21
verses.text: He made him lord of his house, and ruler of all his substance:

verses.name: Psalms 105:22
verses.text: To bind his princes at his pleasure; and teach his senators wisdom.

verses.name: Psalms 105:23
verses.text: Israel also came into Egypt; and Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:24
verses.text: And he increased his people greatly; and made them stronger than their enemies.

verses.name: Psalms 105:25
verses.text: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.

verses.name: Psalms 105:26
verses.text: He sent Moses his servant; and Aaron whom he had chosen.

verses.name: Psalms 105:27
verses.text: They shewed his signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.

verses.name: Psalms 105:28
verses.text: He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebelled not against his word.

verses.name: Psalms 105:29
verses.text: He turned their waters into blood, and slew their fish.

verses.name: Psalms 105:30
verses.text: Their land brought forth frogs in abundance, in the chambers of their kings.

verses.name: Psalms 105:31
verses.text: He spake, and there came divers sorts of flies, and lice in all their coasts.

verses.name: Psalms 105:32
verses.text: He gave them hail for rain, and flaming fire in their land.

verses.name: Psalms 105:33
verses.text: He smote their vines also and their fig trees; and brake the trees of their coasts.

verses.name: Psalms 105:34
verses.text: He spake, and the locusts came, and caterpillers, and that without number,

verses.name: Psalms 105:35
verses.text: And did eat up all the herbs in their land, and devoured the fruit of their ground.

verses.name: Psalms 105:36
verses.text: He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all their strength.

verses.name: Psalms 105:37
verses.text: He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was not one feeble person among their tribes.

verses.name: Psalms 105:38
verses.text: Egypt was glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell upon them.

verses.name: Psalms 105:39
verses.text: He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the night.

verses.name: Psalms 105:40
verses.text: The people asked, and he brought quails, and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

verses.name: Psalms 105:41
verses.text: He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out; they ran in the dry places like a river.

verses.name: Psalms 105:42
verses.text: For he remembered his holy promise, and Abraham his servant.

verses.name: Psalms 105:43
verses.text: And he brought forth his people with joy, and his chosen with gladness:

verses.name: Psalms 105:44
verses.text: And gave them the lands of the heathen: and they inherited the labour of the people;

verses.name: Psalms 105:45
verses.text: That they might observe his statutes, and keep his laws. Praise ye the Lord.
